channel.title: experience on PR
channel.description: Recent content in experience on PR

item.title: How to open/view/share embedded documents in Microsoft Word for Mac (2011/2016)
item.description: You would be surprised to know that Microsoft doesn’t support a viable option to view embedded documents. Embedded PDF’s are the worst, even the .

item.title: Dev Diary
item.description: This is something I’ve started in Jan ‘15. This is to practice a habit of keeping a log of stuff I do which took me a lot of time to figure out myself (may be I’m not efficient?

item.title: iPad Pro and Apple
item.description: Last Sunday, I got to try iPad pro with all its accessories (most of the outlet here has only iPad pro without keyboard & pencil).

item.title: Kids these days
item.description: Last weekend I was fortunate to be a technical evaluator of an hackathon. Yes, I’m trying to be vague here, as my company sponsored this event at a most reputed university of our state, this post is just my view.

item.title: RescueTime weekly summary and Google Script
item.description: I was cleaning up my mac before handing it to systems on my last job. I had a couple of days just for the Knowledge Transfer of projects and nothing else.

item.title: Raspbian + XBMC + Airplay
item.description: TL;DR: Yes, you can. If you are only interested in the steps skip to the relevant section. I own a Raspberry Pi for closer to a year now.

item.title: Some funniest moments from my appraisal
item.description: I had my one-on-one meeting for 2012-13 appraisal this week. I was disappointed with the feedback given to me. Well, I have been _work_ing for very long time, and I know if you are not hurt then it is not an appraisal.

item.title: Laptop Cooling Pad & Sudden Motion Sensor
item.description: Finally I found a good usecase to test the Sudden Motion Sensor of my macbook pro. I was curious to know whether there is an impact of cooling pad’s fan.

item.title: Project Plan and Gantter.com
item.description: Project planning is always a difficult task for me. I could do anything to skip the project planning because for following reasons:

item.title: Expired distribution provisioning and Yak shaving
item.description: Last Thursday one of my iPad app’s provisioning file has expired. Client brought it to us at the very late moment, the iPad app was distributed internally as an enterprise app.

item.title: iCloud Gotchas
item.description: Integrating iCloud with core data was easy when I found this tutorial, but I ran into few issues while implementing and testing it on devices.

item.title: BTServer CPU Usage
item.description: I recently uninstalled all previous versions of xcode (I had all xcode from ios 3.2.x) to install 4.2 on my MBP.

item.title: Idea to action: Tile this
item.description: Not many of my ideas are converted to a project, this one has seen its light last week. Though I haven’t completed all the UI and features of my original vision, it is better to have one working idea than nothing.

item.title: RIL2Insta - Import Read it Later links to Instapaper
item.description: One of my long time wish to write a Chrome extension completed last week. It all started when my answer was down-voted at apple.

item.title: Distribute your iPhone/iPad adhoc builds Over The Air using Dropbox
item.description: Update: I recently found this site called diawi.com which allows you to distribute the app similar to file-sharing sites, drag and drop ipa file and share the link to the testers.

item.title: Shell script to generate images for testing
item.description: Recently I was in need of generating sample images for no. of products in my db. I really hate to create a copy of image for each products in my db.

item.title: How to view (Windows) line ending characters on Mac OSX
item.description: Notepad++ on windows has this beautiful option “View all characters” to display all invisbile characters such as line endings. Programming editors on mac like Textwrangler and Textmate has an option to Show Invisibles but failed to display the character block for Carriage Return as Notepad used to.

item.title: Recommended Git workflow
item.description: I recently started using Git as my revision control tool. Impressed by the use of branching and merging, I create and merge a lot of branches.

item.title: Shane Warne - The Leader
item.description: Color me surprised, I was amazed by his replies. Here is my favourite one Harsha Bhogle: What you strive to do as a leader?

item.title: Enter into / Exit from Recovery mode for iPhone
item.description: Yes, every post you come across suggest the same thing, hold your power button and home button for X seconds. Though it is true, unfortunately I had a couple of situations my iphone doesn’t respond to the key combinations.

item.title: Capture screenshot of the app with iPad simulator
item.description: Until recently I was not aware of the shortcut _Ctrl + Cmd + C _ It captures the complete content of the iPad simulator to the clipboard, You can save it to a file by File -> New from Clipboard with preview.

item.title: Idea Vault: Tile this!
item.description: Update: Check the extension and more information @ Idea to action: Tile this I was recently hunting images for a sample design.

item.title: Import Delicious bookmarks to Evernote including tags
item.description: It is unfortunate to know that Yahoo is going to shutdown/transfer the awesome Delicious bookmarking service. Evernote does not support direct import of bookmarks from delicious as it does with Google notebook.

item.title: Idea Vault: When is that?
item.description: I guess like me there will be many people often confuse appointments/client calls due to timezone differences. I am not talking about people who send/receive schedules from Outlook (or similar apps).

item.title: Custom UISplitViewController now available on GitHub
item.description: I created this custom UISplitViewController as one of my iPad project required Split view for only one screen. The default UISplitViewController provided by Apple can only be added to UIWindow which means you can’t use it with normal UINavigation based project with only one splitview screen.

item.title: GotoMeeting Video recording (G2M3 codec for Mac)
item.description: If you use GotoMeeting to record video of the shared screen, make sure that you DO NOT use G2M3 codec. It does a great job in compressing the size of the video but it is not compatible with OSX or any OS other than Windows.

item.title: Snow Leopard (Retail) on Lenovo 3000 N100
item.description: Disclaimer: There is no alternative to real Mac, if you like Mac go and buy it. If buying a real Mac is too much, you can at least buy a license for Mac OS X Snow Leopard which costs $29 only.

item.title: Angry Birds – I give up
item.description: Angry Birds is one great app in Apple App Store that worth every penny (Full version is only $0.99) I am not a great gamer, I give up on games too early.

item.title: Random Notes: LAMP/Web development |Tools & Best practices
item.description: I was planning to write a post similar to this for very long time. My intension is to help beginners to know the jargons and best practices.

item.title: WWDC 2010 - iPhone 4
item.description: iPad didn’t replace common tasks. Steve was referring his notepad on stage:). Old habits die hard. Steve can still memorize 24 countries and repeat them in the same order.

item.title: iPad - My Experience
item.description: Warning: My observations are biased as I’m not an Apple Fanboy, at least right now (was one in the past, I both respect and hate Apple & Microsoft)
